nodes.documentation:
@title Bank
This contract allows the owner to deposit reserves(debt token), earn interest and
origination fees from users that borrow against their collateral.
The oracle for Bank is Tellor.
nodes.name: Bank

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the owner of the bank
nodes.name: owner

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function sets the fundamental parameters for the bank
     and assigns the first admin
nodes.name: init

nodes.documentation: @dev This function sets the collateral token properties, only callable one time
nodes.name: setCollateral

nodes.documentation: @dev This function sets the debt token properties, only callable one time
nodes.name: setDebt

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the Bank owner to deposit the reserve (debt tokens)
@param amount is the amount to deposit
nodes.name: reserveDeposit

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "NOT ENOUGH DEBT TOKENS IN RESERVE"

arguments.value: NOT ENOUGH DEBT TOKENS IN RESERVE

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "NOT ENOUGH DEBT TOKENS IN RESERVE"

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the Bank owner to withdraw the reserve (debt tokens)
@param amount is the amount to withdraw
nodes.name: reserveWithdraw

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the user to withdraw their collateral
@param amount is the amount to withdraw
nodes.name: reserveWithdrawCollateral

nodes.documentation:
@dev Use this function to get and update the price for the collateral token
using the Tellor Oracle.
nodes.name: updateCollateralPrice

nodes.documentation:
@dev Use this function to get and update the price for the debt token
using the Tellor Oracle.
nodes.name: updateDebtPrice
liquidate

nodes.documentation:
@dev Use this function to allow users to deposit collateral to the vault
@param amount is the collateral amount
nodes.name: vaultDeposit

nodes.documentation:
@dev Use this function to allow users to borrow against their collateral
@param amount to borrow
nodes.name: vaultBorrow
vaultRepay

nodes.documentation: @dev Allows users to withdraw their collateral from the vault
nodes.name: vaultWithdraw

nodes.documentation: @dev This function sets the debt token properties, only callable one time
nodes.name: setDebt

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the Bank owner to deposit the reserve (debt tokens)
@param amount is the amount to deposit
nodes.name: reserveDeposit

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the Bank owner to withdraw the reserve (debt tokens)
@param amount is the amount to withdraw
nodes.name: reserveWithdraw

nodes.documentation:
@dev This function allows the user to withdraw their collateral
@param amount is the amount to withdraw
nodes.name: reserveWithdrawCollateral

using the Tellor Oracle.

@dev Use this function to get and update the price for the debt token

@dev Use this function to allow users to deposit collateral to the vault
@param amount is the collateral amount

@dev Use this function to allow users to borrow against their collateral

getCollateralTokenAddress().details: Getter function for debt token address

getCollateralTokenLastUpdatedAt().details: Getter function for the collateral token last update time

getCollateralTokenPrice().details: Getter function for the collateral token price

getCollateralTokenPriceGranularity().details: Getter function for the collateral token price granularity

getCollateralizationRatio().details: Getter function for the current collateralization ratio

getCurrentValue(uint256).details: Allows the user to get the latest value for the requestId specified

params._requestId: is the requestId to look up the value for

getCurrentValue(uint256).return: bool true if it is able to retreive a value, the value, and the value's timestamp

getDataBefore(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Allows the user to get the first value for the requestId before the specified timestamp

params._limit: a limit on the number of values to look at
params._offset: the number of values to go back before looking for data values
params._requestId: is the requestId to look up the value for
params._timestamp: before which to search for first verified value

getDataBefore(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.return: bool true if it is able to retreive a value, the value, and the value's timestamp

getDebtTokenAddress().details: Getter function for debt token address

getDebtTokenLastUpdatedAt().details: Getter function for the debt token last update time

getDebtTokenPrice().details: Getter function for the debt token(reserve) price

getDebtTokenPriceGranularity().details: Getter function for the debt token price granularity

getInterestRate().details: Getter function for the current interest rate

getLiquidationPenalty().details: Getter function for the liquidation penalty

getName().details: Getter function for the bank name

getOriginationFee().details: Getter function for the origination fee

getReserveBalance().details: Getter function for the debt token(reserve) balance

getReserveCollateralBalance().details: Getter function for the debt reserve collateral balance

getVaultCollateralAmount().details: Getter function for the user's vault collateral amount

getVaultCollateralizationRatio(address).details: Getter function for the collateralization ratio

getVaultDebtAmount().details: Getter function for the user's vault debt amount

getVaultRepayAmount().details: Getter function for the user's vault debt amount  uses a simple interest formula (i.e. not compound  interest)

init(address,string,uint256,uint256,uint.details: This function sets the fundamental parameters for the bank     and assigns the first admin

liquidate(address).details: Anyone can use this function to liquidate a vault's debt, the bank admins gets the collateral liquidated

params.vaultOwner: is the user the bank admins wants to liquidate

owner().details: Returns the owner of the bank

reserveDeposit(uint256).details: This function allows the Bank owner to deposit the reserve (debt tokens)

reserveWithdraw(uint256).details: This function allows the Bank owner to withdraw the reserve (debt tokens)

reserveWithdrawCollateral(uint256).details: This function allows the user to withdraw their collateral

setCollateral(address,uint256,uint256,ui.details: This function sets the collateral token properties, only callable one time

setDebt(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).details: This function sets the debt token properties, only callable one time

updateCollateralPrice().details: Use this function to get and update the price for the collateral token using the Tellor Oracle.

updateDebtPrice().details: Use this function to get and update the price for the debt token using the Tellor Oracle.

valueFor(bytes32).details: Allows the user to get the latest value for the requestId specified using the ADO specification for the standard inteface for price oracles

params._bytesId: is the ADO standarized bytes32 price/key value pair identifier

valueFor(bytes32).return: the timestamp, outcome or value/ and the status code (for retreived, null, etc...)

vaultBorrow(uint256).details: Use this function to allow users to borrow against their collateral

vaultDeposit(uint256).details: Use this function to allow users to deposit collateral to the vault

vaultRepay(uint256).details: This function allows users to pay the interest and origination fee to the vault before being able to withdraw

vaultWithdraw(uint256).details: Allows users to withdraw their collateral from the vault

devdoc.title: Bank This contract allows the owner to deposit reserves(debt token), earn interest and origination fees from users that borrow against their collateral. The oracle for Bank is Tellor.
